\mgl subjunctiveadverb know ANTIPASS COND SBJNC 
\ps adv NotSure vv Attachestoanycategory v:Any 
\eng I wish I teach.
\id 1938

\ref 1939
\tph anti-ki=tero=ni ne-wa huren-pʰe-piri-ka
\mph anti -ki =tero =ni ne -a huren -pʰe -pirin -ka 
\mgl why IRR =other =1SG.SBJ who FUT know ANTIPASS COND SBJNC 
\ps NotSure Attachestoanycategory NotSure NotSure NotSure v:Any NotSure vv Attachestoanycategory v:Any 
\eng I wish I teach.
\id 1939

\eng

\ref 2159
\tph ari-pʰe mento iski=ni hure-ta-ŋka-wa-ka mi-tsi=nino hure-ta-ŋka-wa-ka
\mph aɽini  -pʰe kámento iski =ni hure -ta -ŋka -a -ka mi -tsi =ni no hure -ta -ŋka -a -ka 
\mgl order ANTIPASS inanycase that =1SG.SBJ heat CAUS PASS FUT 1/2IND know FORM =1SG.SBJ no heat CAUS PASS FUT 1/2IND

\ref 6354

\eng    For instance, there are musicians who play many different songs and dancing songs that our ancestors left us as a seed that flourishes everyday and never dies, this is why all the P’urhepechas feel really proud when they hear their songs play at parties/celebrations.
\id 6636

\ref 6637
\tph jini Icha ka Takuru mantani inchateru-echa-ni eka tata jurhiata incha-ni jarha-j-ka tata k'eri-echa=ksï ue-ra-sïn imeri nimakua-echa-ni jinkoni ka jima=ksï uaxa-mu-ku-sïn-ti=ksï ka ioarhi-sïn-ti=ksï nimakua-echa-ni ka uirhi-nt'a=ksï t'arhepeti-tu-ni ka pinanti-sïn kura-nti-a-ni uanta-nt's-kua-echa-ni eska na kaxumbi-na-p-ka iontki isï uani-kua ireta-echa utasï=ksï patsa-xa-ti juchari ampake-ti tati-echa-ri ka tata k'eri-echa-ri jananarhikua-kua

\eng In the area of Ichan and Tacuro every afternoon when the sun goes down, the elderly come out of their homes with their grandchildren and they sit outside, and they call their grandchildren who quickly run to meet with them and they stay quiet to listen respectfully to their stories, like people used to back in the day; in many different towns, they continue to practice the traditions (jananarhikua) of our parents and gradparents.

\ref 6901

\tph jimajkani=ksï korhoka-s-ti eska maru uakasï-echa ke-tsi-mu-xa-p-ka uiri ka iamintu-echa etsa-pa-kuarhe-na-s-ti kejtaku-ni che-pa-ri-ni

\eng Then they heard coming some oxen cominng down running and everyone scared, spread to step aside
